      • init

      • newTransaction

        @RequestMapping(value="/newTransaction",
                method=GET,
                produces="application/json")
@ResponseBody
public Transaction newTransaction​(@RequestParam(value="fromAccount",required=true)
                                  int fromAccountID,
                                  @RequestParam(value="toAccount",required=true)
                                  int toAccountID,
                                  @RequestParam(value="fromUser",required=true)
                                  int fromUserID,
                                  @RequestParam(value="amount",required=true)
                                  float amount,
                                  @RequestParam(value="date",required=true)
                                  java.lang.String transactionDate,
                                  @RequestParam(value="description",required=true)
                                  java.lang.String transactionDescription,
                                  @RequestParam(value="transactionCategory",required=true)
                                  java.lang.String transactionCategory,
                                  @RequestParam(value="transactionType",required=true)
                                  java.lang.String transactionType,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest response)
        If amount is negativ, fromUser und toUser, fromAccount, toAccount will switch. Changes: 12.11.2019 @RequestParam fromUser, required = false @RequestParam toUser, required = false

        This Method represents a REST-Interface to create a new Transaction

        Parameters:
        fromAccountID - accountID where transaction is comming from
        toAccountID - accountID which the transaction is for
        fromUserID - userID from which user the transaction is beeing created
        amount - represents the actual amount of the specified currency
        transactionDate - represents the date or timestamp when the transaction was created
        transactionDescription - Description for the transaction
        request - REQ-Client informations
        response - RES-Client informations
        Returns:
        Transaction
